page.title: 02ACROSS THE SEA TO IRELAND
page.content: Stranraer to Larne, thirty three miles, is one of the shortest commercial sea routes to Ireland.The 3 ferries currently using this route are the Antrim Princess,The Galloway Princess and the Darnia.The Antrim Princess is named after County Antrin in Ireland,The Galloway Princess is named after our region in Scotland. A former ferry on this route,The Caledonian Princess was named after Caledonia;an ancient name for Scotland.Originally in 1662 the cross channel service was between Portpatrick and Donaghadee, but in 1861 a private company was formed witha view to running a service between Stranraer and Larne to connect with the railway on the Scottish side and the recently opened Carrickfergus and Larne railway on the Irish side.
